Hey Colin, nice demos!  I was looking at some of your parameters and 
I wanted to ask a few implementation questions and make a few 
comments:

-Why is the default pmutate_add_connection setting at 77%?  That 
seems extremeley high..so almost every mating leads to a new 
connection?  

-Why is pmutate_connections_weights on the other hand at only 0.2?  
Does that mean only 20% of matings have any mutation of weights?

-What is "elitism proportion?" The standard NEAT use of elitism is 
to just keep one clone of the champ of every species that has been 
alotted over 5 offspring in the next generation.  So it is species-
based elitism.  But what does yours do?

-The selection proportion of 0.1 is very low and will likely cause 
premature convergence.

-My version of NEAT generally solves the single pole balancing 
problem (with velocities) in under 1000 evaluations...so some of the 
differences between the implementations probably are worth looking 
into.  It looks like it takes maybe 10 times longer or more in 
SharpNEAT.

-What is the weight mutation power and rate, i.e. how much do you 
perturb weights and how likely is it any particular weight will be 
perturbed?  Also, is there a max weight?

ken


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:
> There is a new release on the (slightly reorganized) SharpNEAT web 
site 
> http://www.cgreen.dsl.pipex.com/
> 
> A single-pole-balancing domain is available along with a pole 
balancing 
> simulation tool. There is a perfect pole balancing network in the 
> 'networks' dir, but don't take my word fot it, try evolving one 
for 
> yourself :)
> 
> The prey capture domain is still being worked on, the fitness 
function 
> currently employed punishes for the number of timesteps taken to 
catch 
> the prey. Right now though the punishment needs re-adjusting (it's 
too 
> harsh) so you probably won't see very good results without 
modification. 
> Again, the current best network is in the 'networks' dir.
> 
> In the main tool new search parameters are provided: 'Species 
droppoff 
> age' and 'Interspecies mating proportion'.
> 
> Colin.
